phase_goal: Implement Level 1 and Level 2 of the Markdown-Only Automation Workflow to enhance development efficiency for Phase 2 and beyond.
success_metrics: Level 2 Workflow Driver Component Implemented: `WorkflowDriver` class constructor updated to accept `Context`; `file_exists` and `list_files` methods implemented and unit tested.

tasks.description: Create the `src/cli/write_file.py` module with a basic placeholder `write_file(filepath, content)` function that currently does nothing (just a `pass` statement).
tasks.Success Criteria: File `src/cli/write_file.py` exists with a `write_file` function that accepts `filepath` and `content` arguments and contains only a `pass` statement. File is valid Python syntax.
tasks.Mitigation: Use a linter to check syntax, double-check file path, add type hints.
tasks.Future Automation: Automated code generation, static analysis of the function.

tasks.description: Create a unit test for the placeholder `write_file` function in `tests/test_workflow_driver.py` to ensure it exists and doesn't raise exceptions. (Test should pass trivially).
tasks.Success Criteria: Unit test runs without errors. Assertion checks the function exists and doesn't raise an exception when called. Test file increases coverage.
tasks.Mitigation: Double-check test setup, ensure correct assertion is used. Validate file path to confirm correct file.
tasks.Future Automation: Automated test execution in CI pipeline.

tasks.task_name: Implement Task Selection: Get list of tasks from roadmap
tasks.description: Modify `WorkflowDriver` to load tasks into class, making them easily accessable. Also verify correct `load_roadmap` to prepare for task filtering.  File to modify: `src/core/automation/workflow_driver.py`
tasks.Success Criteria: Verify load_roadmap returns same number of tasks. Also verify file permissions

tasks.task_name: Implement Task Selection: Select first 'Not Started' task
tasks.description: Implement basic logic in `WorkflowDriver` to iterate through `tasks` to select the *first* task with the status 'Not Started'. Return the selected task (as a dictionary). If no 'Not Started' tasks exist, return `None`. File to modify: `src/core/automation/workflow_driver.py`
tasks.Success Criteria: The function iterates returns a task with `Not Started`, None will be returned, first task with status is selected
tasks.Potential Risks: Incorrect load order, fails to return tasks
tasks.Mitigation: Make sure to account for load and validate.

tasks.description: Create unit tests for the task selection logic in `WorkflowDriver`, covering cases where a 'Not Started' task exists, and where no 'Not Started' tasks exist. File to modify: `tests/test_workflow_driver.py`
tasks.Success Criteria: Create a new test, verify that tasks work and not, verify function is correct

tasks.description: Implement the core file writing logic in `write_file.py`. The function should take a `filepath` and `content` as input, and write the `content` to the specified file. Handle basic file I/O exceptions (e.g., `FileNotFoundError`, `PermissionError`). Use `try...except` blocks to handle errors and log them.
tasks.Success Criteria: The function writes content to a file, catches FileNotFoundError, PermissionError and logs relevant messages.
tasks.Potential Risks: Unable to write, permission errors, file not found
tasks.Mitigation: Increase logging, use try/except, ensure folder permissions are correct. Ensure validation occurs and that write_file does not over write. Sanitize content.

tasks.description: Implement overwrite checks in the `write_file.py`. The function should check if the specified `filepath` already exists and raise a `FileExistsError` if so (when `overwrite=False`). Add an `overwrite=False` argument to the `write_file` function. Path injection to be avoided.
tasks.Success Criteria: The function should error or overwrite according to the arguments

tasks.description: Create unit tests for the `write_file` function, covering successful file writing, handling file I/O exceptions, and the overwrite check (both `overwrite=True` and `overwrite=False` cases). File to modify: `tests/test_workflow_driver.py`. Ensure testing also validates exceptions and edge cases.
tasks.Success Criteria: All tests for IO exceptions work, over write flags are successful, edge cases tested.
tasks.Potential Risks: Poorly validated code that's not secure
tasks.Mitigation: Ensure validation to correct any attacks

tasks.description: Modify the `WorkflowDriver` to use the `write_file` tool when it needs to write a file. This will likely involve adding a method to the `WorkflowDriver` to call the `write_file` function. File to modify: `src/core/automation/workflow_driver.py`
tasks.Success Criteria: Ensure workflow runs according to plans
tasks.Potential Risks: Incompatible with test or driver class.
tasks.Mitigation: Test that plans can run successfully
tasks.Future Automation: Use integration engine to ensure tests function

tasks.task_name: Implement CLI - Integrate with WorkflowDriver: Argument Parsing
tasks.description: Integrate the CLI with the `WorkflowDriver`. Add the ability to specify the roadmap and output directory via command-line arguments. Modify `src/cli/main.py`. Use try...except and validation for filepath and outputs.
tasks.Success Criteria: Arguments can be passed via the prompt.
tasks.Potential Risks: Fails to validate, errors can trigger
tasks.Mitigation: Try, exceptions, check all cases work.

tasks.task_name: Implement CLI - Integrate with WorkflowDriver: Task Execution
tasks.description: Connect the CLI to the `WorkflowDriver`'s task selection logic. When a task ID is provided, the CLI should call the `WorkflowDriver` to execute that task.  For now, this execution can just print a message indicating the task being executed. Modify `src/cli/main.py`.
tasks.Success Criteria: Run command and then verify that the workflow triggers.
tasks.Mitigation: Make sure instructions can trigger successfully

tasks.description: Create unit tests for the CLI, covering argument parsing and the integration with the `WorkflowDriver`. File to modify: `tests/test_cli.py` (create this file if it doesn't exist).
tasks.Success Criteria: New test file, correct setup of function calls, exceptions tested
tasks.Potential Risks: Code won't run, or does bad actions
